title: Trade Tariffs, Labor Reforms, and Economic Adjustments Shape Domestic Landscape
subtitle: Report automatically generated on 2026-01-13 by the Trade Section, EU Delegation to Colombia
summary: The Colombian economy is navigating a complex period marked by significant policy shifts and economic adjustments. New tariffs imposed by international actors necessitate a reassessment of export strategies [[REF:b099a7a8-0b1f-4bb7-96ed-4725bc442c8b]]. Domestically, a substantial minimum wage increase is triggering widespread labor market adjustments and wage compression effects [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. The government is also grappling with public transport fare increases and energy rate policies, indicating ongoing economic policy debates [[REF:79edf6bf-c48f-4d93-8dff-cb641361151d]][[REF:004a5bc9-a2c5-4460-b3d9-5fbaa59fa6d1]]. Meanwhile, labor reforms are set to alter the payment of severance interest in 2026, aiming to improve financial planning [[REF:c0ca46c7-f938-4e34-9317-bff972c5d3fa]].

sections.title: Trade and International Relations Dynamics
sections.body: The imposition of a 25% tariff by Donald Trump on Iran's partners has prompted Latin American governments, including Colombia, to re-evaluate their traditional export routes and partnerships [[REF:b099a7a8-0b1f-4bb7-96ed-4725bc442c8b]]. This global trade development underscores the need for strategic adaptation in international commercial relations. Concurrently, President Gustavo Petro has convened the Advisory Commission on Foreign Relations to discuss critical points related to border security and international cooperation, indicating a focus on strengthening external engagements [[REF:91f75218-2d5b-4b23-8397-ed4fb08b6a2f]]. The president also issued a stern warning to the ELN, stating that joint military operations with Venezuela would be pursued if the group does not join the peace process and vacate Venezuelan territory [[REF:ad721b43-7f12-47c6-afc5-9771ceafaa53]]. These international policy stances highlight the evolving geopolitical and trade landscape.

sections.title: Economic Policy and Labor Market Adjustments
sections.body: The Colombian labor market is undergoing significant transformations in 2026, largely driven by a substantial 23% increase in the minimum wage [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. This surge is creating a domino effect of internal wage adjustments and wage compression across the salary structure, posing challenges for businesses and workers alike in formal employment [[REF:2a637c03-7833-42dd-98a4-a312ebaa8211]]. Furthermore, the upcoming Labor Reform in 2026 will introduce changes to the payment of severance interest, aiming to improve financial planning for both employees and companies [[REF:c0ca46c7-f938-4e34-9317-bff972c5d3fa]]. Separately, new regulations concerning the UVT by DIAN will impact how pensions are taxed, with certain pensioners potentially being exempt from income tax [[REF:f1cd3c56-20d2-4973-b71d-fd6638f88236]]. The Ministry of Health is also projecting a significant increase in its payroll by $59.403 million in 2026, creating 442 new positions amidst a crisis in the healthcare system [[REF:e18ec143-d191-4047-ab4b-acda923ac265]].

subsections.title: Transportation and Energy Rate Debates
subsections.body: The government has officially challenged the 10.9% fare increase for TransMilenio in Bogota, arguing that the justification based solely on the minimum wage increase is insufficient [[REF:79edf6bf-c48f-4d93-8dff-cb641361151d]][[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]]. The Ministry of Transportation has requested a detailed technical analysis to support the decision to raise the fare from $3,200 to $3,550 pesos [[REF:624d95c5-12c4-4917-a36b-c79ccf14d9b8]]. In parallel, President Gustavo Petro has publicly criticized former presidents Álvaro Uribe and Iván Duque concerning energy rates and past governmental actions, indicating ongoing political debate on utility pricing and energy policy [[REF:004a5bc9-a2c5-4460-b3d9-5fbaa59fa6d1]].

sections.title: Economic Outlook and Sectoral Performance
sections.body: The broader economic outlook for the country in 2026 is shaped by uncertainty surrounding upcoming parliamentary and presidential elections, although hopes are placed on potential changes in government [[REF:9f058851-0697-49db-abde-a581e9bb6ecd]]. Recent data from September 2025 indicated growth in industrial production and sales, showing a recovery from previous negative rates [[REF:9f058851-0697-49db-abde-a581e9bb6ecd]]. Globally, OECD inflation stood at 3.9% in November, with food prices contributing to a decrease while energy prices saw an increase [[REF:5b6421ce-5129-49fb-a4ff-6d60407f595e]]. Notable food price increases in 2025, including coffee, tea, cocoa, sweets, and meat, were largely attributed to climate change by the European Central Bank [[REF:a4d13076-a52d-4e41-8a01-46275a15dc5d]].

sections.title: Governance and Institutional Matters
sections.body: The Minister of Justice has suspended the transfer of criminal gang leaders to Barranquilla, citing social pressure and conflicting statements, a situation that also prompted the Mayor of Cartagena to propose a regional summit [[REF:370895e7-1af9-42f4-844d-b52dac4bdf91]][[REF:af42e6d9-a1e8-40a5-aedc-c62d233c1ab8]]. Meanwhile, allegations of political pressure on RTVC contractors have surfaced, suggesting job continuity may be conditional on political support and electoral participation [[REF:a22acaff-7aa1-4a3d-a2fe-e9e544f10452]]. Authorities in Antioquia have released an image of a suspect, alias Yosa, accused of installing ELN flags and other security-related offenses, amidst ongoing investigations into criminal ties [[REF:7a1f8f0b-f396-4b03-ac44-29073f698376]].
